thread.title: West Brom star Jake Livermore is £10million restoration man who loves caring for classic E-type Jaguar cars with dad
thread.title_full: West Brom star Jake Livermore is £10million restoration man who loves caring for classic E-type Jaguar cars with dad

author: wdownes
title: West Brom star Jake Livermore is £10million restoration man who loves caring for classic E-type Jaguar cars with dad
text:
JAKE LIVERMORE used to be a Tiger — but says nothing beats the roar of a Jaguar. 
Car-buff Livermore recharges his batteries by restoring vintage E-type Jags with his dad. Getty Images 6 Jake Livermore , is looking to help his side pull away from West Ham on Saturday 
The West Brom midfielder, signed from Hull for £10million last month, is looking to help his side pull away from West Ham on Saturday. 
He said: “I enjoy restoring classic cars in my spare time. 
“My dad always liked them growing up — and I’ve always been very close to my father. 
“We’re going through a project now, which keeps us close. Classic Jaguar E-types likes this are what what Jake Livernore and his dad enjoy working on Reuters Livermore move from Hull to West Brom in January and has hit the ground running in the Hawthorns West Brom 1-0 Stoke City : James Morrison early strike is enough to clinch three points Related Stories Swansea vs Leicester team news: Fernando Llorente expected to shake off a niggle for Swans TEAM NEWS Burnley vs Chelsea team news: Eden Hazard fit for Blues as new-boys Robbie Brady and Ashley Westwood push for first Clarets starts TEAM NEWS Liverpool vs Spurs: Danny Rose and Jan Vertonghen set to miss the clash, while Dejan Lovren is a doubt Team news West Ham vs West Brom: What is the team news, what time is it, what TV channel is it on? Preview Sunderland welcome back experienced defender John O'Shea and Adnan Januzaj while Sofiane Boufal out for Southampton Getty Images Livermore and his dad share the joys of classic car restoration and maintenance Getty Images The former Tottenham midfielder cost Tony Pulis £10million Getty Images Livermore and his father love classic e-type jags like this classic First look at Jaguar C-X16 
“It’s great to be able to pick up your phone to talk about good performances on a Saturday and getting a great win. 
“But it’s also nice to pick up the phone and sometimes share different interests as well. 
“I drive one myself, a Series 1 E-Type. But the idea is to keep them for my kids and grandkids in years to come.”
